15.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

15.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
15.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Greatly, exceedingly, abundantly, vehemently. Adverb from perissos; superabundantly.

15.parse: Verb - Present Participle Passive - Genitive Masculine Singular
15.str2: To remind, admonish, be reminded, remind myself; pass: I remember, recall. From ana and mimnesko; to remind; to recollect.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.

15.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
15.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Obedience, submissiveness, compliance. From hupakouo; attentive hearkening, i.e. compliance or submission.

15.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 2nd Person Plural
15.str2: To take, receive, accept, welcome. Middle voice of a primary verb; to receive.

15.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
15.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.
(a) fear, terror, alarm, (b) the object or cause of fear, (c) reverence, respect. From a primary phebomai; alarm or fright.
A trembling, quaking, fear. From tremo; a 'trembling', i.e. Quaking with fear.

16.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
16.str2: A primary verb; to be 'cheer'ful, i.e. Calmly happy or well-off; impersonally, especially as salutation, be well.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

16.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
16.str2: To be courageous, confident, of good cheer. Another form for tharseo; to exercise courage.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

16.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
16.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
